title: Fattoria La Vialla 2014 LeccioMoro  (Montecucco)
description: You'll find subdued aromas of leather, red currant and forest floor on this blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot. The simple palate delivers mature plum and toast offset by drying tannins. Drink soon.

title: Gordon Estate 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Coffee, raspberry, green herb, dill and vanilla aromas are followed by light but plump fruit flavors. It goes down easy.

title: Steiner Family Vineyards 2013 Temper Tantrum Tempranillo (Fair Play)
description: This full-bodied wine brings a basket full of fruit to the table. It smells like grape juice and black cherries, and tastes plummy, almost jammy but not sweet. The tannins and acidity are lighter than usual, making it easy to enjoy.

title: Rockburn 2015 Devil's Staircase Pinot Gris (Central Otago)
description: Like most Pinot Gris, this is subdued aromatically, but does unfold on the palate to reveal sweet melon and pear flavors. A burst of citrusy acids on the finish give it a sweet-tart balance that would work well with various spicy Asian dishes.

title: Rooster Hill 2015 Estate Grown and Produced Cabernet Franc-Lemberger (Finger Lakes)
description: Brambly and a bit herbaceous, this blend of Cabernet Franc and Lemberger offers crisp black currant and berry flavors accented by hints of cedar and toast. While bold in body, it's a bit delicate in concentration, finishing with a lingering fringe of fine-textured tannins.

title: Snoqualmie 2014 Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of wood spice, tar, green herbs and black cherry lead to plump fruit flavors. Grainy dry tannins provide support.

title: Gratia 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Gritty berry aromas come with notes of cheesy oak and road tar. This feels clunky and syrupy, but not unfriendly. Candied, reedy flavors of berry fruits and brown sugar finish jagged, with medicinal green notes.

title: Gratien et Meyer NV Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)
description: This pure Cabernet Franc is perfumed and crisply fruity. It has balanced acidity as well as a soft, creamy character. Red-berry fruits go well with a citrus aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Philippe Viallet 2015 White (Savoie)
description: This is a blend of local grapes including Jacquère and Altesse. It is a ripe style of wine that is full of pear, melon and sweet orange fruit. It is ready to drink, fruity and deliciously bright.

title: Pinino 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: This easy-drinking red opens with pretty aromas of purple wild flower and red berry. The slim, simple palate offers tart sour cherry and orange zest alongside brisk acidity and angular, somewhat fleeting tannins.

title: Poggio il Castellare 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Aromas of violet, cured meat, sage and a whiff of underbrush lead the nose. The light simple palate offers up cranberry, sour cherry and a hint of orange zest alongside both firm acidity and relaxed tannins.

title: Vigilance 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills Lake County)
description: This is an easy-drinking, attractively fruity and seemingly sweet wine with medium body and a soft texture.

title: Trapiche 2016 Perfiles Calcareo Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: This new Chardonnay from chalky soils smells of lanolin and waxy orange. On the palate, this shows some minerality but mostly it's bulky and citric. Briny stone-fruit flavors finish flat.

title: Lasseter 2014 Voilà Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine is made from 50% Sémillon, 29% Sauvignon Blanc and 21% Sauvignon Blanc Musqué clone, the fruit sourced from both the Monte Rosso and Leveroni vineyards. It's fleshy and full of fig flavor, laced in mild lemon, quince and oaky vanilla.

title: Lion-Gri 2014 Golden Land Dry Pinot Gris (Moldova)
description: There's a slight note of oxidation in the bouquet that leads to aromas of pineapple upside down cake, apple and Meyer lemon. Flavors of apple pie and canned peaches precede a dry, crisp finish.

title: François Lurton 2016 Piedra Negra Alta Colección Pinot Gris Rosado (Valle de Uco)
description: Aromas of citrus and talcum powder are a bit muddled. This rosé of Pinot Gris feels lean, jumpy and juicy, while tangy flavors of citrus and stone fruits finish with a mild spritzy tingle. Other than that, there's not much to this.
designation: Piedra Negra Alta Colección Pinot Gris

title: Carillon 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: This straightforward red has aromas of woodland berries and violets. The simple palate offers up sour cherry, a hint of grilled herb and a saline note alongside brisk acidity and angular tannins.

title: Cave des Producteurs de Vouvray 2014 Les Dîmes  (Vouvray)
description: This is an off-dry wine, which is not indicated on the label. Honey and lemon flavors partner with ripe pears and lively acidity. The balance is just right, giving a wine that is ready to drink.

title: Valentín Bianchi NV Brut Méthodo Tradicional Sparkling
description: Dry stone-fruit and desert-herb aromas lead to a mild soft low-acid palate. Pithy mildly bitter peach and melon flavors finish peachy, round and easy.

title: Buena Vista 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This medium-bodied red from county-wide sources is herbaceous, offering dry, somewhat green tannin and lingering spiciness of black pepper.

title: Cà della Scala 2011  Amarone della Valpolicella
description: This offers subdued aromas suggesting leather, raisin, spice and menthol. The bracing palate displays dried prune, tobacco and the heat of alcohol but not much fruit richness. Raspy tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: Waterbrook 2015 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Citrus and melon-rind aromas lead to off-dry, medium-bodied fruit flavors. The concentration comes off as quite light.

title: Artesa 2013 Limited Release Tempranillo (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal red, tannic and soft, with slightly astringent notes behind the notions of dried cherry and blackberry. Leather, herb and tobacco all make themselves known.

title: Boeger 2015 Chardonnay (El Dorado)
description: Medium bodied and soft in texture, this wine has a pale, brownish-gold color, butter and vanilla flavors, and a lingering vanilla finish.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Collection La Minée  (Bourgogne)
description: Named after a parcel of vines, the wine is light and fruity. It has crisp red fruits and fresh acidity. The wine is soft and ready to drink.

title: Steiner Family Vineyards 2013 Free Bird 19 Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: Raisin and prune aromas and flavors mark this full-bodied wine as very, very ripe. It has a soft, relaxed texture and earthy notes on the finish.

title: Magistrate 2015 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: A bit thin on the nose, this shows dried oregano, baked red plum and touches of vanilla and caramel on the herbally forward nose. Black tea, cranberry, pomegranate, oregano and marjoram come through on the palate.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2014 Petit Bourgeois Cabernet Franc (Val de Loire)
description: With spice and a touch of tannin, this attractive, fruity wine is ready to drink. It is supple with red fruits and a smoky background. Drink this wine now.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Les Jeunes Vignes Rosé (Sancerre)
description: Produced from young Pinot Noir vines, this has attractive red fruits and lively acidity. Crisp, with only the minimum of tannins, it is totally ready to drink.

title: Kon Tiki 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Valley)
description: Plum and animal aromas are okay. A chunky, rubbery palate is full but lacking in shape and nuance. This tastes of peppery plum and berry in front of a limited finish with notes of hard spice and berry fruits.
